chapter.title: Samba
chapter.para: Samba is an Open Source application that provides an SMB implementation for POSIX-compatible operating systems.
Providing support for a Windows-based file-sharing protocol on POSIX servers sometimes requires mapping Windows semantics to POSIX semantics.
Samba has always been catching up with Microsoft. Here is a list of Samba releases and what they support (or will support).

sect1.title: Samba 2.2
sect1.para: Full CORE and Workgroup support. Somewhat basic NT4-style support.

sect1.title: Samba 3.0
sect1.para: Full CORE and Workgroup support. Almost complete NT4-style support.

sect1.title: Samba 4.0
sect1.para: Full CORE, Workgroup, NT4 and ADS support.
